instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: 01958 <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> unstable
threads.message: It does go to DFU so I tried DFU revive and restore. Board goes to 20V and draws up to about 100 mA but then back to 0. No shorts on the coils. I replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> as it was getting hot. That is no longer getting hot but Im guessing it's cpu issue if <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> is unstable? Following the power up sequence that is the first rail that appears to be unstable.

threads.title: 01958 <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> unstable
threads.message:
Any history available?
DFU was completed without errors?

L7700 pulses at same time with <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: 01958 <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> unstable
threads.message:
I got an error once during restore but a couple of times it just goes to the lock like its done so I assume it finished but no boot of course. Yes pulses at L7700 that's how I discovered. 

Board was liquid damage but not bad. worst areas were <TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR> and that seems to be working and <CHIP>U6500</CHIP>. I checked diode readings of <TRANSISTOR>Q7401</TRANSISTOR> because it was near some signs and that seems ok.

threads.title: 01958 <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> unstable
threads.message:
No shorts on the coils"
Not always only short is bad.
You should compare values for all power rails with good board, or refference table.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]
Don't forget Power FETs section (page 66).

Also check diode mode for T2 data lines closer to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at J6100.
Any liquid sing on audio board?

Did you test the board alone on the desk?
